title: Burj Khalifa
subtitle: The tallest building in the world
description: The Burj Khalifa towers over all. It's almost 200 meters (700 feet) taller than the Shanghai Tower, the world's second tallest building, and nearly twice as tall as the Empire State Building, which once stood as the world's tallest building from 1931 to 1970.

title: Shanghai Tower
subtitle: The tallest building in the world and it's not even close
description: In February 2014, two Russian urban explorers broke into the unfinished Shanghai Tower and climbed all the way up to the top. They filmed their dangerous climb, and you can watch their footage

title: Abraj Al-Bait Towers
subtitle: A gargantuan tower in Islam's holiest city
description: Translated as "The Towers of the House", the Abraj Al-Bait's central building is the world's tallest clock tower. Its clock face, also the world's largest, can be seen from over 17 kilometers (10 miles) away.

title: Ping An Finance Center
subtitle: The tower of Shenzhen
description: Ping An Finance Center is named after China's Ping An Insurance company, which has its headquarters in the building. Ping An can be translated as "Safe and Well", which is the opposite of the daring

title: Lotte World Tower
subtitle: Seoul, grace, elegance
description: The graceful design of the Lotte World Tower was inspired by traditional Korean art. But don't its elegant form fool you. The building can withstand earthquakes measuring 9 on the

title: One World Trade Center
subtitle: America's tallest building
description: The One World Trade Center was constructed on the site of the original World Trade Center, which consisted of twin tower destroyed during the

title: CTF Finance Centre
subtitle: The terracotta tower
description: Guangzhou's CTF Finance Centre is notable for its application of white glazed terracotta in the vertical mullions that line the full height of the building. The choice to use terracotta was inspired by Chinese locale. In traditional Chinese architecture, terracotta is often used to make tiles for roofs and in sculpture such as for the famous Terracotta Army.

title: Taipei 101
subtitle: World's tallest building from 2004-2010
description: The Taipei 101 was the world's tallest building from 2004 until 2010, when it was surpassed by the Burj Khalifa. In Chinese culture, the number 8 is considered a lucky number. So the tower above the base features 8 segments, each consisting of 8 floors.

title: Shanghai World Financial Center
subtitle: The bottle opener
description: The Shanghai World Financial Center is China's fourth tallest building and the nineth tallest in the world. Its most distinctive feature is the trapdezoid aperture at the peak, which makes the tower look like a giant bottle opener.

title: International Commerce Centre
subtitle: The tallest building in Hong Kong, the city of skyscrapers
description: The International Commerce Centre consists of office space, an observation deck called Sky100, and a five-star hotel, the Ritz-Carlton, Hong Kong. The hotel has the world's highest swimming pool called the OZONE, which can be found on the 118th floor.
